sen.j: 平瀬 作五郎（ひらせ さくごろう、安政3年1月7日 (旧暦)（1856年2月12日） - 大正14年（1925年）1月4日）は、明治・大正期の植物学者。
sen.e: Sakugoro HIRASE (February 12, 1856 - January 4, 1925) was a botanist in the Meiji and the Taisho periods.
Sakugoro HIRASE (February 12, 1856 - January 4, 1925) was a botanist in the Meiji and the Taisho periods.
Sakugoro HIRASE (February 12, 1856 - January 4, 1925) was a botanist in the Meiji and the Taisho periods.
He was born in Fukui City.

sen.j: 1875年、図画教員となり、各所を転々。
sen.e: In 1875, he became an art teacher and moved from area to area.
In 1875, he became a drawing teacher and moved from place to place.
sen.cmt: an artをa drawingに、areaをplaceにしました。
sen.e: In 1875, he became a drawing teacher and moved from place to place.

sen.j: 1888年、東京大学理科大学に雇われ、1890年助手となる。
sen.e: In 1888, he was employed at the College of Science, Tokyo University and became a research assistant in 1890.
In 1888, he was employed by the College of Science, Imperial University of Tokyo, and in 1890 became a research assistant there.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1888, he was employed by the College of Science, Imperial University of Tokyo, and in 1890 became a research assistant there.

sen.j: 主として図画を描いていたが、植物学に興味をいだく。
sen.e: His job was mainly to draw pictures, from which he developed an interest in botany.

sen.j: 東京大学植物学教室の助手の時代にイチョウの精子を世界ではじめて確認した。
sen.e: When he was a research assistant at the botanical laboratory of Tokyo University, he observed the spermatozoids of ginkgo for the first time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When he was a research assistant at the botanical laboratory of Imperial University of Tokyo, he identified spermatozoids of ginkgo first in the world.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: When he was a research assistant at the botanical laboratory of Imperial University of Tokyo, he identified spermatozoids of ginkgo first in the world.

sen.j: 平瀬作五郎によるイチョウの精子の発見は、池野成一郎によるソテツの精子の発見に先立つ1894年1月である。
sen.e: He discovered the spermatozoids of ginkgo in January 1894, before Seiichiro IKENO discovered the spermatozoids of cycad.
He discovered the spermatozoids of ginkgo in January 1894, before Seiichiro IKENO discovered the spermatozoids of cycad.
He discovered the spermatozoids of ginkgo in January 1894, before Seiichiro IKENO discovered the spermatozoids of cycad.

sen.j: 平瀬は、当時東京帝国大学の植物学教室の画工から助手になってまもなく、寄生虫かと思って当時助教授だった池野成一郎に見せた。
sen.e: Shortly after he was promoted to a research assistant from a drawing technician at the botanical laboratory of Tokyo Imperial University, he showed the ginkgo spermatozoids to Seiichiro IKENO, who was an associate professor then, thinking they were parasitic worms.
sen.cmt: 時代を考え、「edakumi」とはせず、drawing technician としました。
sen.e: Shortly after he was promoted to a research assistant from a drawing technician at the botanical laboratory of Imperial University of Tokyo, he showed to associate professor Seiichiro IKENO, spermatozoids of ginkgo, which he found but mistook for some parasite worms.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: Shortly after he was promoted to a research assistant from a drawing technician at the botanical laboratory of Imperial University of Tokyo, he showed to associate professor Seiichiro IKENO, spermatozoids of ginkgo, which he found but mistook for some parasite worms.

sen.j: 池野は一目見るなり「精子だ」と直感したという。
sen.e: At first glance, IKENO recognized them as spermatozoids intuitively.
At first glance, IKENO recognized them as spermatozoids intuitively.

sen.j: その後1896年9月9日に「花粉管端より躍然精虫の遊動して活発に転々突進する状況を目撃」し、10月には「イチョウの精虫について」という論文を発表している。
sen.e: On September 9, 1896, HIRASE "witnessed sperm dashing out of the pollen tube and moving around vigorously, " and published a paper titled "Spermatozoids of ginkgo " in October.
sen.cmt: 学生ではないので、論文はthesis ではなく、paper としました。
sen.e: On September 9, 1896, HIRASE "witnessed sperm dashing out of the pollen tube and moving around vigorously, " and published a paper titled "Spermatozoids of ginkgo " in October.
On September 9, 1896, HIRASE "witnessed sperm dashing out of the pollen tube and moving around vigorously, " and published a paper titled "Spermatozoids of ginkgo " in October.

sen.j: これが世界で初めての裸子植物における精子の発見となり、池野成一郎によるソテツの精子の発見と合わせて、日本人による植物学への最も輝かしい貢献となった。
sen.e: This was the first discovery of gymnosperm spermatozoids in the world and has become a remarkable contribution to botany by a Japanese person, together with discovery of cycad spermatozoids by Seiichiro IKENO.

This was the first discovery of gymnosperm spermatozoids in the world and his discovery as well as Seiichiro IKENO's discovery of cycad spermatozoids was the most remarkable contribution to botany made by Japanese people.
sen.cmt: 「最も」：訳抜け。 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: This was the first discovery of gymnosperm spermatozoids in the world and his discovery as well as Seiichiro IKENO's discovery of cycad spermatozoids was the most remarkable contribution to botany made by Japanese people.

sen.j: 平瀬作五郎は、その後1年して滋賀県立彦根東高等学校へ転出し、一時は研究も断念、不幸な時期を体験している。
sen.e: Sakugoro HIRASE was transferred out to Hikone-higashi Prefectural High School of Shiga and abandoned his study once, which was his unhappiest period in life.
One year later, Sakugoro HIRASE was transferred out to Hikone-higashi Prefectural High School of Shiga and had to abandon his research once, having a hard time.
sen.cmt: 「その後1年して」：訳抜け。「最も不幸」という意味は原文にはないのでunhappiestは不適当です。後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: One year later, Sakugoro HIRASE was transferred out to Hikone-higashi Prefectural High School of Shiga and had to abandon his research once, having a hard time.

sen.j: しかし1912年、恩師ともいえる池野成一郎とともに、それぞれイチョウとソテツの精子の発見を高く評価されて、恩賜賞 (日本学士院)を授与されている。
sen.e: However, in 1912, together with Seiichiro IKENO who can be said as his mentor, HIRASE was awarded Onshi Prize (by the Japan Academy).

In 1912, however, HIRASE, together with Seiichiro IKENO who can be said to have been his mentor, was awarded Onshi Prize (the Imperial Award) (by the Japan Academy), for their highly evaluated discoveries of gymnosperm spermatozoids and cycad spermatozoids respectively.
sen.cmt: 「それぞれイチョウとソテツの精子の発見を高く評価されて」：訳抜け。全文書換えとしました。
sen.e: In 1912, however, HIRASE, together with Seiichiro IKENO who can be said to have been his mentor, was awarded Onshi Prize (the Imperial Award) (by the Japan Academy), for their highly evaluated discoveries of gymnosperm spermatozoids and cycad spermatozoids respectively.

sen.j: ほとんど学歴のない平瀬が、恩賜賞を授与されるというのは異例のことであった。
sen.e: It was quite unusual that HIRASE with almost no academic background was conferred Onshi Prize.
It was quite unusual that Onshi Prize was given to a person like HIRASE having almost no academic background.
sen.cmt: 全文書換えとしました。

sen.j: もっともはじめは平瀬作五郎の授与は予定されていなかったらしく、「平瀬が貰わないのなら、私も断わる」と池野成一郎がいうので、2人受賞になったという。
sen.e: Initially, Sakugoro HIRASE was not planned to be awarded, but since Seiichiro IKENO said, "I will not receive the prize if HIRASE does not receive," both of them were awarded at the same time.

Although Sakugoro HIRASE was not initially included in prize recipients, Seiichiro IKENO said, 'I will refuse to receive the prize if HIRASE is not given the prize,' and as a result, both received the prize.

sen.j: 平瀬作五郎が精子を発見したイチョウの木は、今でも東京都文京区白山にある小石川植物園の中に、記念の石碑を建てて保存されている。
sen.e: The ginkgo tree of which Sakugoro HIRASE discovered the spermatozoids is still preserved inside of Koishikawa Botanical Gardens in Hakusan, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo, with the commemorative stone monument.
